channel.title: New Project, Base & Client Ideas }
channel.description:
Hi all, I joined rsps communities a little over 2 weeks ago in the hopes to learn about rsps's and gain some experience to start a project from an empty but clean base. I know a bit bout Java and have the knowledge to take it far. As for Rsps's, I am a noob, so this will be an enjoyable learning experience for me.
I want to know what you all think is a strong, clean & empty framework to start with. I also want to know what you think a good client base to use with my source is. Currently I would like to use a 474 revision. I like everything about rs up to the release of the Godwars Dungeon.
I've worked mostly with PI and have found it to be very clustered and buggy. So please try to refrain from suggesting it.
So let me know! What should I begin with??

item.title: New Project, Base & Client Ideas }
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

jummppy:

Idk I would say rs2server(474) maybe. Delta++ and convert it over to a pi client or something. I would recommend to just stay away from pi the best you can.

he said no pi, and delta is just as bad, despite the millions of "delta cleaned’

But yes, get Rs2 Server. It’s based off hyperion, which is one of the best programmed sources yet

edit: just realized how much jummpyyy made rs2 server seem like a pi :palm:

Read full topic
